meanings.definition: A musical instrument consisting of a series of glass bowls or goblets graduated in size to produce musical tones when rubbed with the fingers.
meanings.sent1: The armonica produced beautiful music when the musician gently rubbed the glass bowls.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed playing the armonica at the concert, creating enchanting melodies.
meanings.sent3: The armonica at the party seemed to sing along with the guests, adding a magical touch to the atmosphere.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was like an armonica, delicate and resonant, filling the room with harmony.
meanings.sent5: The moonlight danced on the armonica, creating a mesmerizing display of colors and sounds.

meanings.definition: A type of eyeglasses with lenses made of glass or crystal.
meanings.sent1: He wore the armonica to help him see clearly, the glass lenses enhancing his vision.
meanings.sent2: Her stylish armonica added a touch of elegance to her outfit, the crystal lenses sparkling in the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The armonica slipped off his nose comically, making everyone laugh at the unexpected moment.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes behind the armonica seemed like windows to another world, mysterious and captivating.
meanings.sent5: The armonica framed her face beautifully, accentuating her features with a touch of sophistication.
